column5: I have been toying around to slow my troll down a tad and its worked. This is what I have found so far. I have used the plastic eco bags from the barn etc, they do work but they will rip easily. Ok so I seen the bags at homedepot and gave one a shot today Tough as nails so far for a buck No need to cut holes at all, it worked well On a better note it worked best a foot out and a foot in from the stern Better than 80$ a pop.
i've used an Ikea bag for years.   work excellent! i have 2 drift socks but half the time i find myself throwing the ikea bag over first!

I find the socks take up valuable space thats needed.Being a newbie to this trolling thing, I find the green hd bags tough enough, esp for a buck a bag.And the metro plastic ones will tear easily and still work.
Slightly more expensive,but I have used a couple of collapse able camping buckets for 10 years without a hitch including a couple of high speed runs when I forgot I had them out  :wallbash:  vance
if you can throw a pic or two on so i can see your setups. thanks
And do you have any added pics of the planer board mast?
Sorry no updates yet on my progression, too busy trolling for chromies In time I will show you guys, as for the socks, I do have a pick and it worked perfectly again today
awesome im interested to see it and how you have it rigged up to your boat
